alert.note: Alert for Allen; Beauregard; East Cameron; Northern Calcasieu; Northern Jefferson Davis; Southern Calcasieu; West Cameron (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 25 at 5:00AM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN CAMERON... NORTHWESTERN JEFFERSON DAVIS...BEAUREGARD...CALCASIEU AND SOUTHWESTERN ALLEN PARISHES THROUGH 530 AM CST... At 500 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Singer to near Edgerly to near Johnsons Bayou. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to vegetation and outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lake Charles, Sulphur, Cameron, Westlake, Iowa, Reeves, Grand Lake, Dry Creek, Singer, Moss Bluff, Johnsons Bayou, Sugartown, De Quincy, Ragley, Lake Charles Regional Airport, Sabine National Wildlife, Hacketts Corner, Topsy, Lebleu Settlement, and Gillis. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 14 and 44. Interstate 210 between mile markers 1 and 12. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Allen; Beauregard; East Cameron; Northern Calcasieu; Northern Jefferson Davis; Southern Calcasieu; West Cameron
